availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John B. Payne (Union Co, Ky, farmer)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to H.H. Payne. Father of Joseph Payne, Mary P. Payne, Martha Payne, John E. Payne, William H. Payne, James Payne, Fanny H. Payne, Charles W. Payne. Farmer in Union County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned nine enslaved persons in Union County in 1850. Farmer in Union County in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Union County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2, p. 497B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 332-333.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, p. 402A.
Find A Grave, "J.B. Payn (May 1806-July 20, 1888)," Memorial #105072566, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/105072566 (accessed January 24, 2020).
